required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Safety and Efficacy of VX-661 in Combination With Ivacaftor in Subjects With Cystic Fibrosis, Homozygous for the F508del-CFTR Mutation With an Open-Label Expansion
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Randomized, Multicenter, Double Blind, Placebo Controlled Study to Evaluate Safety, Efficacy, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of VX-661 in Combination With Ivacaftor for 12 Weeks in Subjects With Cystic Fibrosis, Homozygous for the F508del CFTR Mutation With an Open-Label Extension

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study was to evaluate the safety and efficacy of VX-661in combination with ivacaftor in participants with cystic fibrosis (CF) who are homozygous for F508del cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR) mutation

primary_outcome.measure: PC Phase: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.description: AE: Any untoward medical occurrence in a participant during the study; the event does not necessarily have a causal relationship with the treatment. This includes any newly occurring event or previous condition that has increased in severity or frequency after the informed consent form is signed. AE includes serious as well as Non-serious AEs. SAE (subset of AE): medical event or condition, which falls into any of the following categories, regardless of its relationship to the study drug: death, life threatening adverse experience, Inpatient hospitalization/prolongation of hospitalization, persistent/significant disability or incapacity, congenital anomaly/birth defect, important medical event. AEs with start date or increased severity on or after the first dose of study drug through the end of study participation considered treatment-emergent. Baseline was defined as Day 1 of PC Phase.

primary_outcome.measure: OLE Phase: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent AEs and SAEs
primary_outcome.description: AE: Any untoward medical occurrence in a participant during the study; the event does not necessarily have a causal relationship with the treatment. This includes any newly occurring event or previous condition that has increased in severity or frequency after the informed consent form is signed. AE includes serious as well as Non-serious AEs. SAE (subset of AE): medical event or condition, which falls into any of the following categories, regardless of its relationship to the study drug: death, life threatening adverse experience, Inpatient hospitalization/prolongation of hospitalization, persistent/significant disability or incapacity, congenital anomaly/birth defect, important medical event. AEs with start date or increased severity on or after the first dose of study drug through the end of study participation considered treatment-emergent. Baseline was defined as Day 1 of the OLE Phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: PC Phase: Absolute Change From Baseline in Percent Predicted Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) Through Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 is the volume of air that can forcibly be blown out in one second, after full inspiration. Baseline was defined as Day 1 of PC Phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: OLE Phase: Absolute Change From Baseline in Percent Predicted FEV1 Through Week 40
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 is the volume of air that can forcibly be blown out in one second, after full inspiration. Baseline was defined as Day 1 of the OLE Phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: PC Phase: Relative Change From Baseline in Percent Predicted FEV1 Through Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 is the volume of air that can forcibly be blown out in one second, after full inspiration. Baseline was defined as Day 1 of PC Phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: OLE Phase: Relative Change From Baseline in Percent Predicted FEV1 Through Week 40
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 is the volume of air that can forcibly be blown out in one second, after full inspiration. Baseline was defined as Day 1 of the OLE Phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: PC Phase: Absolute Change From Baseline in Sweat Chloride Through Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Sweat samples were collected using an approved collection device. Baseline was defined as Day 1 of PC Phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: OLE Phase: Absolute Change From Baseline in Sweat Chloride Through Week 40
secondary_outcome.description: Sweat samples were collected using an approved collection device. Baseline was defined as Day 1 of the OLE Phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: PC Phase: Absolute Change From Baseline in Body Weight at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline was defined as Day 1 of PC Phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: OLE Phase: Absolute Change From Baseline in Body Weight at Week 40
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline was defined as Day 1 of the OLE Phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: PC Phase: Absolute Change From Baseline Body Mass Index (BMI) at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: BMI was calculated using following formula: BMI = Weight in kg/height in square meter (m^2). Baseline was defined as Day 1 of PC Phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: OLE Phase: Absolute Change From Baseline BMI at Week 40
secondary_outcome.description: BMI was calculated using following formula: BMI = Weight in kg/height in m^2. Baseline was defined as Day 1 of the OLE Phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: PC Phase: Absolute Change From Baseline in Cystic Fibrosis Questionnaire-Revised (CFQ-R) Respiratory Domain Score Through Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The CFQ-R is a validated participant-reported outcome measuring health-related quality of life for participants with cystic fibrosis. Respiratory domain assessed respiratory symptoms (for example, coughing, congestion, wheezing), score range: 0-100; higher scores indicating fewer symptoms and better health-related quality of life. Baseline was defined as Day 1 of PC Phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: OLE Phase: Absolute Change From Baseline in CFQ-R Respiratory Domain Score Through Week 40
secondary_outcome.description: The CFQ-R is a validated participant-reported outcome measuring health-related quality of life for participants with cystic fibrosis. Respiratory domain assessed respiratory symptoms (for example, coughing, congestion, wheezing), score range: 0-100; higher scores indicating fewer symptoms and better health-related quality of life. Baseline was defined as Day 1 of the OLE Phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: PC Phase: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of VX-661 and IVA
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 2, 3, 4, 6, 9 and 12 hours post-dose on Day 85

secondary_outcome.measure: PC Phase: Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time 0 to 24 Hours (AUC0-24h) of VX-661
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 2, 3, 4, 6, 9 and 12 hours post-dose on Day 85
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) sampling was performed up to 12 hours post-dose on Day 85. For Arm VX-661 50 mg q12h + IVA 150 mg q12h (VX-661 q12h regimen), area under the concentration versus time curve from time 0 to 12 hours (AUC0-12h) was multiplied by 2 to obtain AUC0-24h.

secondary_outcome.measure: PC Phase: Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time 0 to 12 Hours (AUC0-12h) of IVA
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 2, 3, 4, 6, 9 and 12 hours post-dose on Day 85

secondary_outcome.measure: PC Phase: Time to Reach Cmax (Tmax) of VX-661 and IVA
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 2, 3, 4, 6, 9 and 12 hours post-dose on Day 85

arm_group.arm_group_label: PC Phase: VX-661 50 mg q12h + IVA 150 mg q12h
arm_group.description: Participants received VX-661 50 milligram (mg) tablet plus Ivacaftor (IVA) 150 mg tablet every 12 hours (q12h) for 12 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: PC Phase: VX 661 placebo q12h + IVA placebo q12h
arm_group.description: Participants received placebo matched to VX-661 tablet plus placebo matched to IVA tablet q12h for 12 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: PC Phase: VX-661 100 mg qd + IVA 150 mg q12h
arm_group.description: Participants received two VX-661 50 mg tablets once daily (qd) plus IVA 150 mg tablet q12h for 12 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: PC Phase: VX -661 placebo qd + IVA placebo q12h
arm_group.description: Participants received two placebo matched to VX-661 tablets qd plus placebo matched to IVA tablet q12h for 12 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: OLE Phase: VX-661 100 mg qd + IVA 150 mg q12h
arm_group.description: Participants who completed 12 week PC phase underwent a washout period of at least 4 weeks before entering the OLE phase and received two VX-661 50 mg tablets qd plus IVA 150 mg tablet q12h for 48 weeks in OLE phase.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Homozygous for the F508del CFTR mutation
- FEV1 ≥40% and ≤90% of predicted normal for age, sex, and height
- Stable CF disease as judged by the investigator
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of any comorbidity that, in the opinion of the investigator, might confound the results of the study or pose an additional risk in administering study drug to the participant
- Pregnant and nursing females: Females of childbearing potential must have a negative pregnancy test at screening and Day 1 of the PC Phase and Day -7 or Day 1 of the OLE Phase (whichever was applicable)
- Sexually active participants of reproductive potential who are not willing to follow the contraception requirements
- The participant or a close relative of the participant is the investigator or sub investigator, research assistant, pharmacist, study coordinator, or other staff directly involved with the conduct of the study.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The study consisted of 2 phases: a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled (PC) phase in which participants received either VX-661 in combination with Ivacaftor (IVA), or matched placebo and an open-label extension (OLE) phase in which participants received VX-661 in combination with IVA.

group.title: PC Phase: VX-661 50 mg q12h + IVA 150 mg q12h
group.description: Participants received VX-661 50 milligram (mg) tablet plus IVA 150 mg tablet every 12 hours (q12h) for 12 weeks.

group.title: PC Phase: VX-661 Placebo q12h + IVA Placebo q12h
group.description: Participants received placebo matched to VX-661 tablet plus placebo matched to IVA tablet q12h for 12 weeks.

group.title: PC Phase: VX-661 100 mg qd + IVA 150 mg q12h
group.description: Participants received two VX-661 50 mg tablets once daily (qd) plus IVA 150 mg tablet q12h for 12 weeks.

group.title: PC Phase: VX -661 Placebo qd + IVA Placebo q12h
group.description: Participants received two placebo matched to VX-661 tablets qd plus placebo matched to IVA tablet q12h for 12 weeks.

group.title: OLE Phase: VX-661 100 mg qd + IVA 150 mg q12h
group.description: Participants who completed 12 week PC phase underwent a washout period of at least 4 weeks before entering the OLE phase and received two VX-661 50 mg tablets qd plus IVA 150 mg tablet q12h for 48 weeks in OLE phase.

participants_list.participants: 12 participants completed PC phase, but did not enter OLE phase.

baseline.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) was defined as all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug in PC Phase.

outcome.description: AE: Any untoward medical occurrence in a participant during the study; the event does not necessarily have a causal relationship with the treatment. This includes any newly occurring event or previous condition that has increased in severity or frequency after the informed consent form is signed. AE includes serious as well as Non-serious AEs. SAE (subset of AE): medical event or condition, which falls into any of the following categories, regardless of its relationship to the study drug: death, life threatening adverse experience, Inpatient hospitalization/prolongation of hospitalization, persistent/significant disability or incapacity, congenital anomaly/birth defect, important medical event. outcome.title: PC Phase: Absolute Change From Baseline in Cystic Fibrosis Questionnaire-Revised (CFQ-R) Respiratory Domain Score Through Week 12
outcome.description: The CFQ-R is a validated participant-reported outcome measuring health-related quality of life for participants with cystic fibrosis. Respiratory domain assessed respiratory symptoms (for example, coughing, congestion, wheezing), score range: 0-100; higher scores indicating fewer symptoms and better health-related quality of life. Baseline was defined as Day 1 of PC Phase.

group.description: Participants received VX-661 50 mg tablet plus IVA 150 mg tablet q12h for 12 weeks.

group.title: PC Phase: VX-661 Placebo q12h + IVA Placebo q12h
group.description: Participants received placebo matched to VX-661 tablet plus placebo matched to IVA tablet q12h for 12 weeks.

group.title: PC Phase: VX-661 100 mg qd + IVA 150 mg q12h
group.description: Participants received two VX-661 50 mg tablets qd plus IVA 150 mg tablet q12h for 12 weeks.

group.title: PC Phase: VX -661 Placebo qd + IVA Placebo q12h
group.description: Participants received two placebo matched to VX-661 tablets qd plus placebo matched to IVA tablet q12h for 12 weeks.

measure.title: PC Phase: Absolute Change From Baseline in Cystic Fibrosis Questionnaire-Revised (CFQ-R) Respiratory Domain Score Through Week 12
measure.description: The CFQ-R is a validated participant-reported outcome measuring health-related quality of life for participants with cystic fibrosis. Respiratory domain assessed respiratory symptoms (for example, coughing, congestion, wheezing), score range: 0-100; higher scores indicating fewer symptoms and better health-related quality of life. Baseline was defined as Day 1 of PC Phase.
measure.population: FAS was defined as all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug in PC Phase.

outcome.title: OLE Phase: Absolute Change From Baseline in CFQ-R Respiratory Domain Score Through Week 40
outcome.description: The CFQ-R is a validated participant-reported outcome measuring health-related quality of life for participants with cystic fibrosis. Respiratory domain assessed respiratory symptoms (for example, coughing, congestion, wheezing), score range: 0-100; higher scores indicating fewer symptoms and better health-related quality of life. Baseline was defined as Day 1 of the OLE Phase.
outcome.population: Analysis population was defined as all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug in the OLE Phase.

group.title: OLE Phase: VX-661 100 mg qd + IVA 150 mg q12h
group.description: Participants who completed 12 week PC phase underwent a washout period of at least 4 weeks before entering the OLE phase and received two VX-661 50 mg tablets qd plus IVA 150 mg tablet q12h for 48 weeks in OLE phase.

measure.title: OLE Phase: Absolute Change From Baseline in CFQ-R Respiratory Domain Score Through Week 40
measure.description: The CFQ-R is a validated participant-reported outcome measuring health-related quality of life for participants with cystic fibrosis. Respiratory domain assessed respiratory symptoms (for example, coughing, congestion, wheezing), score range: 0-100; higher scores indicating fewer symptoms and better health-related quality of life. Baseline was defined as Day 1 of the OLE Phase.
measure.population: Analysis population was defined as all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug in the OLE Phase.

outcome.title: PC Phase: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of VX-661 and IVA
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 2, 3, 4, 6, 9 and 12 hours post-dose on Day 85
outcome.population: Analysis population included all participants who received a dose of VX-661 and IVA, whether the participant completed dosing or not and if the dataset(s) supported the noncompartmental analyses.

group.title: PC Phase: VX-661 50 mg q12h + IVA 150 mg q12h
group.description: Participants received VX-661 50 mg tablet plus IVA 150 mg tablet q12h for 12 weeks.

group.title: PC Phase: VX-661 100 mg qd + IVA 150 mg q12h
group.description: Participants received two VX-661 50 mg tablets qd plus IVA 150 mg tablet q12h for 12 weeks.

measure.title: PC Phase: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of VX-661 and IVA
measure.population: Analysis population included all participants who received a dose of VX-661 and IVA, whether the participant completed dosing or not and if the dataset(s) supported the noncompartmental analyses.

outcome.title: PC Phase: Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time 0 to 24 Hours (AUC0-24h) of VX-661
outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) sampling was performed up to 12 hours post-dose on Day 85. For Arm VX-661 50 mg q12h + IVA 150 mg q12h (VX-661 q12h regimen), area under the concentration versus time curve from time 0 to 12 hours (AUC0-12h) was multiplied by 2 to obtain AUC0-24h.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 2, 3, 4, 6, 9 and 12 hours post-dose on Day 85
outcome.population: Analysis population included all participants who received a dose of VX-661 and IVA, whether the participant completed dosing or not and if the dataset(s) supported the noncompartmental analyses. Here, “Number of participants analyzed” signifies those participants who were evaluable for this outcome measure.

group.description: Participants received VX-661 50 mg tablet plus IVA 150 mg tablet q12h for 12 weeks.

group.title: PC Phase: VX-661 100 mg qd + IVA 150 mg q12h
group.description: Participants received two VX-661 50 mg tablets qd plus IVA 150 mg tablet q12h for 12 weeks.

measure.title: PC Phase: Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time 0 to 24 Hours (AUC0-24h) of VX-661
measure.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) sampling was performed up to 12 hours post-dose on Day 85. For Arm VX-661 50 mg q12h + IVA 150 mg q12h (VX-661 q12h regimen), area under the concentration versus time curve from time 0 to 12 hours (AUC0-12h) was multiplied by 2 to obtain AUC0-24h.
measure.population: Analysis population included all participants who received a dose of VX-661 and IVA, whether the participant completed dosing or not and if the dataset(s) supported the noncompartmental analyses. Here, “Number of participants analyzed” signifies those participants who were evaluable for this outcome measure.

event.sub_title: Infective pulmonary exacerbation of cystic fibrosis
Infective pulmonary exacerbation of cystic fibrosis

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: PI is free to publish results of the study after (1) the first multi-center publication, (2) if the sponsor elects not to publish the results, or (3) 18 months after close of the study, whichever occurs first. Proposed publications are to be submitted to the sponsor for review and comment for a period of at least 45 days (which may be extended under certain circumstances related to protection of intellectual property); the sponsor cannot require changes to the proposed publications.
